title: How to Make a Hot Dog and Fries Cake

steps.headline: Create the hot dog bun.
steps.description: Using a bread or a serrated knife, make little indents in the loaf to make your bun. Cut into the loaf, about halfway, on both ends and cut across to get the piece out. You should have a long "top" loaf piece and a "U" shape in your loaf. Keep the piece you cut out.

steps.headline: Insert the Twinkies into the "bun" to make your "hot dog".
steps.description: You can cut and trim off any excess hanging off or leave it as is if you prefer it to extend off of the bun.

steps.headline: Use the red-brown frosting to cover up the Twinkies.
steps.description: You can also take them out of the loaf to frost the sides and bottom. Place them back in the "bun".

steps.headline: Drizzle a squiggly line of red icing.
Add some diced gumdrops or fruit slices.
Take the cut piece from the loaf and cut it in half.
steps.description: Cut both halves into long strips. These will be your fries, so drizzle some red icing on them.

text: Create the hot dog bun. Using a bread or a serrated knife, make little indents in the loaf to make your bun. Cut into the loaf, about halfway, on both ends and cut across to get the piece out. You should have a long "top" loaf piece and a "U" shape in your loaf. Keep the piece you cut out. Insert the Twinkies into the "bun" to make your "hot dog". You can cut and trim off any excess hanging off or leave it as is if you prefer it to extend off of the bun. Use the red-brown frosting to cover up the Twinkies. You can also take them out of the loaf to frost the sides and bottom. Place them back in the "bun". Drizzle a squiggly line of red icing. This will represent the ketchup. Drizzle some yellow icing. This will represent the mustard. Add some diced gumdrops or fruit slices. This will be the relish. Take the cut piece from the loaf and cut it in half. Cut both halves into long strips. These will be your fries, so drizzle some red icing on them.
